info.name: OpenAPI Developer Document
info.description:
What is U home OpenAPI

The U Home OpenAPI provides a seamless and efficient way for your application to integrate with Ultraloq smart locks and U-tec smart home devices, including smart plugs, switches, and lights. By utilizing the U Home OpenAPI, developers can build applications that interact directly with Ultraloq and U-tec devices, monitor and manage device statuses in real time, process event notifications, and execute control commands, providing a fully connected and intelligent smart home solution.

System Architecture

The following illustrations will show how your application interacts with U Home devices:

Get Start With U home OpenAPI

Development Workflow

API Integration Components

The U Home OpenAPI integration framework is composed of three key components:

  • OAuth2 Authentication Service: Facilitates secure cloud-based access and authorization.

  • Device Interaction Interfaces: Enable seamless interaction with devices for control and management.

  • Event and Status Notification Service: Delivers real-time updates on device status and event-driven notifications for efficient monitoring and response.

OAuth2 Authentication Service

OAuth 2.0 is the industry-standard protocol for authorization. OAuth 2.0 focuses on client developer simplicity while providing specific authorization flows for web applications, desktop applications, mobile phones, and living room devices.

In the most typical scenario , your service does not get an access token directly; it must first get an authorization code and then exchange that for an access token (and, optionally, a refresh token so that it can request a new access token when the old access token expires). The following figure shows the relationship between the key components of account linking, which are described later in this topic. For an example of how users experience the account linking flow.

Authorization URI

https://oauth.u-tec.com/authorize?response_type=code&client_id={Client ID}&client_secret={client Secret}&scope=openapi&redirect_uri={Redirect URI}&state={state}

Callback Redirect URI

https://{Redirect URI}?authorization_code={code}&state={state}

Access token URI

https://oauth.u-tec.com/token?grant_type=authorization_code&client_id={Client ID}&client_secret={Client Secret}&code={code}

Refresh token URI

https://oauth.u-tec.com/token?grant_type=refresh_token&client_id={Client ID}&client_secret={Client Secret}&refresh_token={Refresh Token}

OpenAPI Interface Framework

OpenAPI Request URL

https://api.u-tec.com/action

API Authentication

Method 1: Include the access token issued by the OAuth2.0 server in the Authorization header of the HTTP request to interact with the OpenAPI service and perform actions.

POST /action HTTP/1.1
Host: api.u-tec.com
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <OAuth2_Access_Token>

Method 2: Alternatively, the access token can be included in the request body as part of the request payload.

{
   "header": {
     ......
   },
   "authentication":{ 
     "type": "Bearer",
     "token": "<Oauth2_Access_Token>"
   },
   "payload": {
      ......
   },
}

You can choose either of the above methods; however, if both methods are used, the first method (using the Authorization header) takes precedence.

Request Body

{
   "header": {
      "namespace": "Uhome.User",
      "name": "Get",
      "messageId": "Unique identifier, preferably a version 4 UUID",
      "payloadVersion": "1"
   },
   "payload": {
      ......
   }
}

messageId: A universally unique identifier (UUID) version 4, such as `d290f1ee-6c54-4b01-90e6-d701748f0851`. This is a 36-character string made up of 32 hexadecimal digits and 4 hyphens. The string is divided into 5 parts, with character counts as follows: 8-4-4-4-12.

Response Body

{
   "header": {
      "namespace": "Uhome.User",
      "name": "Get",
      "messageId": "Matches the one in the request header."
      "payloadVersion": "1"
   },
   "payload": {
      "user": {
         "id": "abc-ddd-eee-ff",
         "lastName": "Jiang",
         "FirstName": "Jacobs"
      }
   }
}

Response Error

{
   "header": {
      "namespace": "Uhome.User",
      "name": "Get",
       "messageId": "Matches the one in the request header."
      "payloadVersion": "1"
   },
   "payload": {
      "error": {
         "code": "INVALID_TOKEN",
         "message": "Message didn't include the authorization token or the
 token is invalid, expired, or malformed."
      }
   }
}

request.description:
This interface is primarily used to register URIs for U Home-related event notifications, such as device change notifications and event reports.

access_token: When sending push notifications, essential valid authentication information is required. It is recommended that users periodically update this value to ensure connection security. For detailed usage instructions, refer to the Event Notification documentation

url: The registered notification URI address supports only http:// and https:// protocols. When using https://, the SSL/TLS certificate must be obtained from a trusted Certificate Authority (CA).
Retrieve the basic information of the current user.

header.value: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, OPTIONS

response.name: Off
Switch Level Control

request.description: The Discovery interface describes the message used to identify the endpoints associated with a customer device account. You can issue this command and U home OpenApi will respond with a list of all supported devices and their associated properties and capabilities.
Through this interface, you can query the real-time status information of U Home devices.

item.name: Categories Reference
item.description:
categories is a required parameter that helps define what kind of device is being interacted with. U home has an expanding list of device categories

Below is a list of currently supported categories:

  • SmartLock

  • SmartPlug

  • SmartSwitch

  • Light

item.name: Device Handler Types Reference
item.description:
Every device using U home Schema must be associated with a device handler type, indicating the capabilities available on the device.

Name Capabilities
utec-lock Lock, BatteryLevel
utec-lock-sensor Lock, BatteryLevel, DoorSensor
utec-dimmer Switch, Switch Level
utec-switch Switch
utec-light-rgbaw-br Switch, Brightness, Color, ColorTemperature

item.name: Production Capabilities
lock
item.description:
capability: st.lock

Attributes

Name Description Type Value
lockState Lock device status enum - Locked - Device is locked
- Unlocked - Device is unlocked
- Jammed - Device is jammed
- Unknown - Device status is unknown
lockMode Lock device working mode enum - 0 - Normal
- 1 - Passage
- 2 - Locked

Commands

Name Description
lock Lock the device
unlock Unlock the device
setMode(mode) Set the working mode to specified value

Command Parameters

Name Description Type
mode Working mode value to set enum[0,1,2]

item.name: lockuser
item.description:
capability: st.lockUser

Attributes

Name Description Type Value

Commands

Name Description
list Retrieve a list of all users currently on the lock, including user ID, name, user type, user status, etc.
get(id) Query the detailed information of the designated user on the current lock
add(user) Add a new user to the current lock
update(user) Update the information of the specified user on the current lock
delete(id) Delete the information of the specified user currently locked

Command Parameters

Name Description Type
id Lock User ID integer[4-8]
user User Object object
  • user object
{
    name: "<user name>",   //Lock User Name
    type: 0, //0: Normal User; 2: Temporary User; 3: Admin
    password: 123456, //A 4 to 8-digit integer
}
//If the user type you are adding is a temporary user, you must also add the following fields
{
    name: "<user name>",   //Lock User Name
    type: 0, //0: Normal User; 2: Temporary User; 3: Admin
    password: 123456, //A 4 to 8-digit integer
    daterange: ["2024-07-01 00:00", "2024-07-01 23:59"], //Limit the date range during which users can open the door
    weeks: [0,1,2,4,5,6], //0 to 6 represent Sunday to Saturday respectively.
    timerange: ["00:00", "23:59"], //Opening hours each day
    limit: 1 //The number of times the door can be opened. If it is 0 or there is no such field, it means there is no limit.
}
//If you need to modify an existing user, just add the id field.
{
    id: 23456,
    name: "<user name>",   //Lock User Name
    type: 0, //0: Normal User; 2: Temporary User; 3: Admin
    password: 123456, //A 4 to 8-digit integer
    daterange: ["2024-07-01 00:00", "2024-07-01 23:59"], //Limit the date range during which users can open the door
    weeks: [0,1,2,4,5,6], //0 to 6 represent Sunday to Saturday respectively.
    timerange: ["00:00", "23:59"], //Opening hours each day
    limit: 1 //The number of times the door can be opened. If it is 0 or there is no such field, it means there is no limit.
}

item.name: batteryLevel
item.description:
capability: st.batteryLevel

Attributes

Name Description Type Value
level An indication of the status of the battery integer[1...5]

item.name: doorSensor
item.description:
capability: st.doorSensor

Attributes

Name Description Type Value
sensorState An indication of the status of the battery enum Closed - The door is closed
- Open - The door is open
- Unknown - The current state of the door is unknown

item.name: switch
item.description:
capability: st.switch

Attributes

Name Description Type Value
switch A string representation of whether the switch is on or off enum - on - The value of the ``switch`` attribute if the switch is on
- off - The value of the ``switch`` attribute if the switch is off
- Unknown - The state of the device is unknown

Commands

Name Description
off Turn a switch off
on Turn a switch on

item.name: switchLevel
item.description:
capability: st.switchLevel

Attributes

Name Description Type Value
level A number that represents the current level, usually ``1-100`` in percent integer[0-100]

Commands

Name Description
setLevel(level) Set the level to the given value. If the device supports being turned on and off then it will be turned on if ``level`` is greater than 0 and turned off if ``level`` is equal to 0.

Command Parameters

Name Description Type
level The level value, usually 0-100 in percent integer [0..100]

item.name: deferredResponse
item.description:
Typically, if a device operates with an asynchronous response mechanism, we first send a synchronous message to notify that a response may require a certain amount of waiting time. Then, once the operation is successfully completed on the device, an asynchronous response is sent back.

capability: st.DeferredResponse

Attributes

Name Description Type Value
seconds The approximate time before you send your second response, in seconds. Integer[1...20]
Here you can find the list of standard production capabilities maintained by U home. Live Capabilities are available for you to use today.
